page.title: 03Chesterton - the People
page.content: The people of Chesterton come from a greater variety of backgrounds than might be expected. The majority are working class, but movements in the mining industry brought two waves of "immigrants" to the village mostly since the second world war. One group are from what folk here call "t'other Newcastle",that is Newcastle-upon-Tyne. Their presence can mostly be detected in the hint of Geordie accent in the local accent. The second group were Polish. There are still second and third generation Polish surnames on the roll of the High School. The local dialect is difficult for an outsider to follow. However, local people are friendly. Chesterton is a happy village and if someone passes on the street they will probably say "Hello".
